reviews.review_msg: Is a really nice prof and makes lectures enjoyable but material covered in lecture is really surface level compared to homework and exams, you have to teach yourself a lot of the concepts using resources you can find as lecture slides won't help you.

Was a great prof for a hard course.
He was very approachable and very sweet when answering questions.
Just make sure to understand the problem sets and the practice midterms and you'll be okay, know the basics. 
Tests were fair but still tough, there is a lot of content so try to stay on top of it.
Amazing professor, very funny, very accessible. Had many review sessions with practice midterms that were very representative of the final. Make sure you do the problem sets and understand them

He makes Intro to org chem passable. Great sense of humour, very approachable. His friendly demeanour and teaching style made him easy to ask questions to. lectures aren't too heavy, but good notetaking is definitely required since the PowerPoints don't make much sense if you miss the lecture. Exams are difficult, especially the final, but doable.
Dr. Vocadlo is amazing. I highly recommend taking organic chem with him as he explained the concepts really well and made ochem very easy.
This was the hardest class I've taken in my entire career and I am shocked I came out on the other side. David made it bearable, and make sense. He also cares greatly about students' wellbeing.

This course is definitely very difficult. However, The way Dr. Vocadlo teaches does help. He tends to go slow and ease into the course, ensuring you have a solid foundation for OCHEM. The exams are very similar to his practice tests. The best advice I can give is to always attend lectures, preview the lecture material, and attend office hours.

Very good prof and explains things very well! Lots of practice problem sets for tutorials that can be annoying during midterms season, but is very helpful in the long run. Practice midterms/finals are VERY similar so understand those answers and the concepts. Cool dude and is a very entertaining person

David was very clear on what would be tested. He emphasized multiple times throughout lecture what was important to know. He also offered many practice problems and practice assignments. Lectures were also very entertaining, very funny prof.

Dr Vocadlo makes Ochem easier through easy to understand lectures. He also uses iclickers, practice problems and tests to make sure we understand the material before we take our exams. Also, the exam questions are similar to or the same as the practice problems. Even though I got around a C+ to B- range, my mark was scaled to a B.

Great professor. The first midterm was simple, but just prepare for the steep climb in difficultly after midterm 1. Do the problem sets and do LOTS of practice problems for the final. I finished at around a mid 70 but that got curved to an A-. Practice midterms are EXACTLY like the real midterms, same format and question types.

Ochem is so tough, but Dr. Vocadlo made ochem more simple. His practice exams/midterms were very similar if not the same questions as on the actual exams/midterms. Be prepared to do a lot more studying outside of lectures though.

Dr. Vocadlo is an amazing prof who really cares about his students performance. CHEM281 is a very difficult course but he really tries to make it interesting and explain concepts clearly. Weekly problem sets were helpful for keeping up with material, and practice exams represented the actual exams very well.

Ochem is a hard subject but professor David made it easy to understand as long as you pay attention during lectures and do the problem sets. The tests are fair. A problem set per week(each with lots of questions) so don't procrastinate. Some lecture topics might require you to do extra work to understand fully. In short, medium difficulty.

David made Ochem, which is supposedly one of the hardest courses you can take, to be relatively simple. He's a really funny guy and his tests arent bad as you are given practice tests which are actually representative of the real exams. He may just be the goat.

professor was very passionate about the class but lectures were very fast paced. homework questions would still be assigned AND due the day after midterms. his homework, practice midterm, and midterm answer key frequently had errors in them too. a positive is that the practice exams are very similar to actual exams.

the course is hard regardless, but David acc cares for students to succeed. the problem sets are hard but they're not for marks so they are great practice for exams. provides chances for ur grade to improve and explains content well. if u go to him he will help with any questions you have. David rocks
He's not a good explainer and his problem sets are extremely long even on exam weeks.
HE DA GOAT of Organic Chem Department

Reviews look like he wrote them :/ not a bad guy, not a good ochem prof. Didn't love his lecture style (slides were confusing + so hard to get mechanisms without seeing them drawn out + iclicker too easy/didn't help. Did okay bc I studied hard (TAs were great), appreciated practice exams being so similar to real exams + amt of practice Qs given.

Dr. Vocadlo is an excellent professor who takes the time to ensure everyone understands the concept before moving on. He is always willing to answer questions and is very respectful when doing so. His teaching style is very comprehensive and easy to follow.

His lectures were well structured and had lots of good information. He generally kept it interesting and as fun as an organic chemistry lecture can be. He clearly struggles with technology, but who cares about that. Good prof for sure.

Dr.V really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. His midterms were very fair and almost the same as the practice exams. However, the final exam was much harder and focused greatly on the last quarter of the course. It can take a while to receive exam marks. Overall, he's very friendly and does his best to make the course bearable.
Difficult course but he provides concise lecture slides and resources. Lectures are entertaining and occasionally funny. Practice exams are right on track with the real exams. Amazing prof!

Professor Vocadlo made a notoriously difficult chemistry course enjoyable with engaging lectures, reasonable exams, and quality study material. 10/10 game show host with the iClicker questions in lectures!

It's a hard course but Dr. Vocadlo explained concepts really well and lectures were easy to follow. Practice exams are very helpful and similar to the exams. He showed up to our lab once and literally saved my lab. I was having trouble separating chemicals and he helped me with it. He's really nice and approachable, plus he gives good advice too.

It was Prof Vocadlo's first semester teaching CHEM 281 and he did a great job. His lecture slides are clear, he provides helpful practice exams, and extra/optional opportunities for review before the final. Overall, he made this daunting class manageable and borderline enjoyable.
